page.title: 04A TYPICAL SUNDAY
page.content:
I GET UP AT 7.30 AND GET READY FOR RIDING.SARAH,MY FRIEND PICKS ME UP AND WE GO OFF TO CLOUD STABLES.WE RIDE FOR AN HOUR,JUMPING IN AND OUT HAVING FUN. AFTERWARDS I GROOM 'BILLY',WHICH IS THE PONY I LOOK AFTER.WE THEN TACK UP THE HORSES AND PONIES FOR A 10.00 AM RIDE.WE HELP THE RIDERS TO GET ON,AND THEN DO SOME JOBS LIKE TACK CLEANING.THEN WE TACK UP FOR THE NEXT RIDE AND DO MORE JOBS.
EVENTUALLY,IT COMES TO LUNCHTIME AND WE EAT IN THE CHILDRENS' ROOM.THEN WE TACK UP AND MUCK OUT THE PONY BARN AND BOXES.WE DO MORE JOBS AND THEN TURN THE PONIES AND HORSES OUT INTO THE FIELD.WE TALK AND TELL JOKES WHILST CLEANING THE BRIDLES AND SADDLES UNTIL 5.30 PM WHEN MY DAD COMES TO PICK US UP. (BY LUCY DONALD aged 11)
